nodes.bodyText:
why is it not just FlinkResource.get()?
also in MetricsAvailabilityITCase

These tests have are in some form or another reliant on the cluster running locally. In the case of this test IIRC it was because the input CSV file exists locally; for the metrics IT case it is because it assumes the JM to be on the local host.
nit: shorthand for LocalStandaloneFlinkResourceFactory: FlinkResource#getLocal
I would put it before the constructor for code style

is it already expected that there are other types/directions of jar moving?
at this point, it looks that there is only one reasonable way to install things: opt -> lib
btw, it is actually a copy operation, not a move

The proposed code is indeed over-engineered for current usages, but we will soon have operations from opt -> plugins and lib -> opt, and this approach can handle this easier since it doesn't require additional methods.
I will fix the method not doing a move.
moveJar -> copyJar?
a bit strange that only first match gets copied, if it is a prefix, as a user, I would naturally expect all matches to be copied

The method name implies that only 1 jar will be moved.
Only went with prefix since spelling out the entire jar name is error-prone.
We may actually want to fail here if the prefix matches more than one jar, as it was likely a mistake. In any case, not related to this PR as the current behavior isn't new.

Why not to allow copying of multiple matching files?
If so, I like the idea of failing then and jdocs can be extended to state this
at least @param to make it different from get()?

 	 */
 	ClusterController startCluster(int numTaskManagers) throws IOException;
 
+	/**
+	 * Searches the logs of all processes for the given pattern, and applies the given processor for every line for
+	 * which {@link Matcher#matches()} returned true.
+	 *
+	 * @param pattern pattern to search for
+	 * @param matchProcessor match processor
+	 * @return stream of matched strings
+	 */
+	Stream<String> searchAllLogs(Pattern pattern, Function<Matcher, String> matchProcessor) throws IOException;
+
 	/**
 	 * Returns the configured FlinkResource implementation, or a {@link LocalStandaloneFlinkResource} if none is configured.
 	 *
 	 * @return configured FlinkResource, or {@link LocalStandaloneFlinkResource} is none is configured
 	 */
 	static FlinkResource get() {
+		return get(FlinkResourceSetup.builder().build());
+	}
+
+	/**
+	 * Returns the configured FlinkResource implementation, or a {@link LocalStandaloneFlinkResource} if none is configured.
+	 *
+	 * @return configured FlinkResource, or {@link LocalStandaloneFlinkResource} is none is configured

nodes.bodyText: nit: defensive copy
wrong place, should be done in the constructor call
true, also unmodifiableCollection there, why in builder now?

unused leftover?
although I would go with it for now instead of jarMoveOperations if there are no other use cases for it in foreseeable future
indeed leftovers, will remove them. See my above answer for why the jarMoveOperations will stay.
other non-overridden methods can also be package private?
This represents the actual API that would be public if it were in another package; will not change it.
